item.description:
All Shook UP is getting rave reviews.  See the review from Seacoast Online below:  http://www.seacoastonline.com/articles/20130124-ENTERTAIN-301240413

This event has been rescheduled for the 31st, so be sure you make your reservations for this great show right away as the first performances sold out!

Hi Trailblazers!  Come join us as we watch a great show at the Historic Rochester Opera House.  Before the show we will have an optional dinner at the "Governors Inn" (Spaulding Steak & Ale) at 78 Wakefield Street at 6 pm, then walk over to the Opera House which is inside City Hall.

Come shake it up in the club. This play is set in a small Midwestern town in 1955, with this Broadway musical comedy featuring twenty-four Elvis Presley classics like Heartbreak Hotel, Love Me Tender, Can't Help Falling in Love and Don't be Cruel.

Enjoy cocktail seating, cash bar, and a light supper, as great-lookin' motorcycling, guitar-playing roustabout (Chad) blows into town and gets everybody all shook up.  He meets young mechanic Natalie, who is instantly smitten.

He is the most gorgeous man that any girl in town has ever seen. Chad is looking for excitement, but is informed that the mayor has outlawed fun; no tight pants, no public kissing and no loud music.

He decides that he will breathe some life into this dreary little town.  Soon everybody discovers the magic of romance and the power of rock & roll.

All Shook Up is an ROH Production directed by Steve Small with live music directed by Kathy Fink.

The price on Thursday is $25.

Call The Rochester Opera house at:  603-335-1992 to make reservations.  Don't wait--the first 2 performances have already sold out!  The Box Office is open Monday, Wednesday & Friday from 10 to 4.  Mention that you'd like to be seated at the Trailblazers' table.

See  you there!

Peter

* The orchestra floor is leveled, seats replaced with cocktail seating.
* Cash Bar. Under age 18 must be accompanied by an adult.
* Light supper, Desserts and Snacks available (not included in price of ticket).
* So that tables can be arranged to seat your party: please call the box office (603-335-1992) to reserve your table/s.
* Handicap access available in balcony only
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the Lobby of the Rochester Opera House at 7:45 before the show, or come to the Governors Inn for dinner about 6.

group.name: Trailblazers- A Seacoast Singles Meetup Group

item.name: ALL SHOOK UP & Dinner at Governors Inn/Spaulding Steak & Ale
